Title: Water Boils at 100 Degrees Celsius
Text: A well-established fact in physics, water boils at 100 degrees Celsius at sea level due to atmospheric pressure.
Subject: Fact

Title: Earth Orbits the Sun in Approximately 365.25 Days
Text: The Earth completes one orbit around the Sun approximately every 365.25 days, giving us our annual cycle of seasons.
Subject: Fact

Title: Great Wall of China Visible from Space
Text: While the Great Wall of China is not easily visible with the naked eye from space, it can be captured in satellite imagery under the right conditions.
Subject: Fact

Title: Vitamin C Essential for Human Health
Text: Vitamin C, found in fruits like oranges and strawberries, is crucial for maintaining good health and supporting the immune system.
Subject: Fact

Title: Eiffel Tower Completed in 1889
Text: The Eiffel Tower, located in Paris, France, was completed in 1889 and has since become an iconic symbol of the city.
Subject: Fact

Title: Photosynthesis is the Process of Converting Light into Energy
Text: Photosynthesis is the biological process through which plants convert light energy into chemical energy, producing oxygen as a byproduct.
Subject: Fact

Title: Mount Everest is the Tallest Mountain Above Sea Level
Text: Mount Everest, standing at 29,032 feet (8,848 meters), is the highest mountain above sea level. It is part of the Himalayan range.
Subject: Fact

Title: Honey Never Spoils
Text: Archaeologists have discovered pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible. Honey's natural composition prevents spoilage.
Subject: Fact

Title: Cheetahs Can Accelerate from 0 to 60 mph in Just a Few Seconds
Text: Cheetahs are known for their incredible speed and can accelerate from 0 to 60 miles per hour in just a few seconds, making them the fastest land animals.
Subject: Fact

Title: The Pyramids of Giza Were Built as Tombs for Pharaohs
Text: The Pyramids of Giza in Egypt were constructed as tombs for Pharaohs during the Old Kingdom period. They remain iconic symbols of ancient Egyptian civilization.
Subject: Fact

Title: The Earth's Core is Primarily Composed of Iron and Nickel
Text: Scientists believe that the Earth's core is primarily composed of iron and nickel, contributing to the planet's magnetic field.
Subject: Fact

Title: Cows Have Best Friends
Text: Research has shown that cows form strong social bonds and can have best friends within their herds. These friendships have been observed to reduce stress and improve well-being.
Subject: Fact

Title: The Amazon Rainforest Produces 20% of the World's Oxygen
Text: The Amazon Rainforest is often referred to as the 'lungs of the Earth' because it produces approximately 20% of the world's oxygen through photosynthesis.
Subject: Fact

Title: The Leaning Tower of Pisa Leans Due to Shifting Soil
Text: The Leaning Tower of Pisa leans because of unstable soil conditions. It was not originally intended to lean, but the tilt began during construction in the 12th century.
Subject: Fact

Title: Hummingbirds are the Only Birds Capable of Hovering
Text: Hummingbirds are the only birds capable of sustained hovering due to their unique wing structure and rapid wing beats.
Subject: Fact

Title: The Sun is a G-Type Main Sequence Star
Text: The Sun is classified as a G-type main-sequence star, commonly known as a yellow dwarf. It plays a central role in our solar system.
Subject: Fact

Title: Honeybees Can Recognize Human Faces
Text: Research indicates that honeybees have the ability to recognize and remember human faces, showcasing their cognitive abilities.
Subject: Fact

Title: The Nile River is the Longest River in the World
Text: The Nile River holds the title of the longest river in the world, with a length of approximately 6,650 kilometers (4,130 miles).
Subject: Fact

Title: Caffeine is a Natural Pesticide in Coffee Plants
Text: Coffee plants produce caffeine as a natural pesticide. The substance acts as a defense mechanism against insects that may try to consume the plant.
Subject: Fact

Title: Whales Are Mammals, Not Fish
Text: Whales are marine mammals, not fish. They belong to the group of mammals known as cetaceans and share a common ancestor with land mammals.
Subject: Fact
